author: bergmeister
body:
PR #7661 added  [package.tests.ps1](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/test/common/package/package.tests.ps1), to check that all referenced packages are of the latest version. This causes a lot of unnecessary build failures in forks and PRs because it takes time for the bot to kick in and the update to be approved and merged and then one needs to upstream or re trigger the build and hope that no other 3rd party has published a new update in the meantime...
Those tests should be moved to a different build definition that is run e.g. only on a daily basis but definitely not part of CI or a PR. cc @TravisEz13

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: Agreed.  We have added a bot to do this work now.  The tests can be removed or disabled.

comments.author: bergmeister
comments.body: @iSazonov I do not see this issue as closed until the tests are not part of the CI/PR builds any more

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: I'll submit PR to remove these tests

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: No problem, we were just try to find the right solution.  Sometimes it takes trial and error.

title: Tests testing that all packages use the latest version should not be part of CI build
